summary: The bill, titled the "Ensuring Veterans Timely Access to Anesthesia Care Act of 2025," aims to improve anesthesia and pain management services for veterans within the Veterans Health Administration (VHA). It mandates the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to update standards, aligning them with the Defense Health Agency's guidelines for Certified Registered Nurse Anesthetists (CRNAs). The bill outlines certification requirements for anesthesia professionals and mandates reporting by the Comptroller General on anesthesia delivery models within the VHA, including cost-effectiveness analysis.
